translated: Ekeroth, Gunnar, colonel, Gothenburg, born on September 16, 1886 in Stockholm to director Gösta E. and Anna Wahlstedt. Married for 14 years to Ebba Stjärnswärd. Children: Marianne born in 1915, insurance company employee in Stockholm, Carl Gustaf born in 1917, captain in Wendes artillery regiment, married to Magdalena Thott and works for SKF in Gothenburg, Gunnar born in 1918, engineer in Stockholm, married to Vera Wästifelit. Ekeroth served as a second lieutenant in Wendes artillery regiment from 1909 to 1913, as a lieutenant in 1913, as a captain in 1924, as a major in Bodiens artillery regiment in 1933, as a major in Svea artillery regiment in 1936, as a lieutenant colonel in 1936, as a colonel in the army in 1940, and was on reserve in 1941 before becoming the chief of Svea artillery regiment in 1941 and then the colonel and chief of Göta artillery regiment from 1943 to 1946. He served as a member of the artillery staff from 1917 to 1919, as an artillery staff officer from 1919 to 1926, as an adjutant to H. R. H. the Crown Prince from 1927 and accompanied him on a trip to Egypt and Cyprus in 1930 and to the Delaware jubilee in the USA in 1938. Ekeroth received the Order of the Sword, Litteris et Artibus, Royal Victorian Order, Knight of the First Class of the Order of the Seraphim, and the King's Shooting Prize for Battalion Commanders in 1929.

award.name: Knight of the First Class of the Order of the Seraphim
